medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 28-year-old woman, developed retrosternal chest discomfort 4 weeks prior, followed by shortness of breath, myalgias, and fatigue. Symptoms persisted, and she readmitted two days post partum due to worsening dyspnea and orthopnea. Notably, no fevers, night sweats, or gastrointestinal symptoms were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gestational diabetes mellitus; two previous pregnancies were electively terminated. History of asthma managed with an albuterol inhaler. Negative testing for HIV.
medical_history.social_history: Single, in a monogamous relationship, owned a dog, stopped smoking after pregnancy, did not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs, and had no recent travel or significant environmental exposures.
